messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4294
messages.msgSnippet: ... or who wants to sleep extra late, or who is expecting a phone call or company. It s helpful. Ds also writes himself a note the night before because the
messages.messageBody:
>We try always to check the night before about who needs to be where when,
or
who wants to sleep extra late, or who is expecting a phone call or company.
It's helpful.

Ds also writes himself a note the night before because the alarm will go off
in the morning, and he won't remember what he was getting up for.

Laura

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4294
messages.msgSnippet: Some people (men in my family) really live in the moment.  Rarely do ... I d bet they had mothers who did all their thinking ahead for them so they didn t
messages.messageBody:
"> Some people (men in my family) really live in the moment. Rarely do
> they
> think ahead to what they want to do in the next day, much less next
> week.

I'd bet they had mothers who did all their thinking ahead for them so
they didn't develop that ability."

My absent-minded dh certainly didn't have that. His parents expected him to
remember everything, and really came down on him hard when he didn't :(.
We're trying much more gentle ways to help absent-minded ds learn how to
organize.

Laura
